message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a method for automated cardiac motion scoring using deep convolutional neural networks. This involves analyzing cardiac MR sequences to identify regional wall motions and classify them into four types. The paper uses non-local neural networks for segment- and subject-level modeling, which is a popular technique in computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI). The method also involves temporal interpolation of convolution kernels, which is a common technique in multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed method using correlation and accuracy metrics, which are commonly used in neural network evaluation (cs.NE).
